etymologies: Old English gnætt, of Germanic origin; related to German Gnitze

definitions: a small two-winged fly that resembles a mosquito. Gnats include both biting and nonbiting forms, and they typically form large swarms.

notes.text: Several families, including Simuliidae (black flies) and Ceratopogonidae

shortDefinitions: small two-winged fly that resembles mosquito

definitions: a person or thing seen as tiny or insignificant, especially in comparison with something larger or more important

examples.text: I was only a gnat in the affair

shortDefinitions: person regarded as tiny or insignificant
